Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2013 10:17PM Viccha wrote: Got my hair cut short and love it! I now feel ready for my first day of chemo tomorrow (or rather later today). I am going to try to get some sleep.
Posts.Title: Two days before chemo Viccha Maureen1

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2013 08:42AM Viccha wrote: I've been having a tough time after my first chemo treatment last Wednesday. I missed a week or more of 2 meds for depression and anxiety and it all came crashing in on me at once. I called and just got my prescriptions from the pharmacy. I can't believe I let that happen. I was so comsumed by this chemo that I didn't keep track. I still feel horrible with side effects and it's been 6 days. "This too shall pass." I called the oncs nurse this morning because I am at wit's end. She explained the reasons for some of my main concerns, so I'm trying to get through the day. Any words of comfort are welcome. Thanks.
Posts.Title: Two days before chemo Viccha Maureen1

Posts.Content: Viccha wrote: I was diagnosed in May 2013, had lumpectomy in June and start chemo on Wednesday. I'm nervous, scared and pray to God for strength. Currently I'm a little scared of getting my hair cut short on Tuesday. Actually more worried about my reaction and also when I lose all of it. I hope I wear my bald head with pride. I don't feel ready for all of this, but who is, right? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Two days before chemo Viccha Maureen1

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2013 05:23PM Viccha wrote: JeriGrace. I am also in St. Louis. What is the name of the wig store? I'm so scared of losing my hair and have been looking into all options.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2013 Mellie289 JeriGrace

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2013 04:15AM Viccha wrote: Has anyone been treated for depression and anxiety prior to their diagnosis? I take meds daily and due to insurance changes, decided to save some money and order the 90 day supply from Express Scripts. With all of the commotion of my first chemo (7/10) I ran out of 2 different medicines. Everything came crashing down on me right along with my side effects. I called my doctor and got the meds I needed, but I have to keep reminding myself that it will take awhile before the meds work. My husband seems so frustrated. He took off of work today to be with me. I hate making him worry, but it scared me, too. I know he just wants me to get back to work, but I'm not ready.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo July 2013 Mellie289 JeriGrace
